AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappings.name: AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappings
AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappings.documentation: Adds the resource mapping for the draft application version.

CreateApp.name: CreateApp
CreateApp.documentation:
Creates a Resilience Hub application. A Resilience Hub application is a collection of Amazon Web Services resources structured to prevent and recover Amazon Web Services application disruptions. To describe a Resilience Hub application, you provide an application name, resources from one or more–up to five–CloudFormation stacks, and an appropriate resiliency policy.

After you create a Resilience Hub application, you publish it so that you can run a resiliency assessment on it. You can then use recommendations from the assessment to improve resiliency by running another assessment, comparing results, and then iterating the process until you achieve your goals for recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO).

CreateResiliencyPolicy.name: CreateResiliencyPolicy
CreateResiliencyPolicy.documentation: Creates a resiliency policy for an application.

DeleteApp.name: DeleteApp
DeleteApp.documentation: Deletes an AWS Resilience Hub application. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.

DeleteAppAssessment.name: DeleteAppAssessment
DeleteAppAssessment.documentation: Deletes an AWS Resilience Hub application assessment. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.

DeleteRecommendationTemplate.name: DeleteRecommendationTemplate
DeleteRecommendationTemplate.documentation: Deletes a recommendation template. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.

DeleteResiliencyPolicy.name: DeleteResiliencyPolicy
DeleteResiliencyPolicy.documentation: Deletes a resiliency policy. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.

DescribeAppAssessment.name: DescribeAppAssessment
DescribeAppAssessment.documentation: Describes an assessment for an AWS Resilience Hub application.

DescribeAppVersionResourcesResolutionSta.name: DescribeAppVersionResourcesResolutionStatus
DescribeAppVersionResourcesResolutionSta.documentation: Returns the resolution status for the specified resolution identifier for an application version. If resolutionId is not specified, the current resolution status is returned.

DescribeAppVersionTemplate.name: DescribeAppVersionTemplate
DescribeAppVersionTemplate.documentation: Describes details about an AWS Resilience Hub

DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportSt.name: DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportStatus
DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportSt.documentation: Describes the status of importing resources to an application version.

DescribeResiliencyPolicy.name: DescribeResiliencyPolicy
DescribeResiliencyPolicy.documentation: Describes a specified resiliency policy for an AWS Resilience Hub application. The returned policy object includes creation time, data location constraints, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the policy, tags, tier, and more.

ImportResourcesToDraftAppVersion.name: ImportResourcesToDraftAppVersion
ImportResourcesToDraftAppVersion.documentation: Imports resources from sources such as a CloudFormation stack, resource-groups, or application registry app to a draft application version.

ListAlarmRecommendations.name: ListAlarmRecommendations
ListAlarmRecommendations.documentation: Lists the alarm recommendations for a AWS Resilience Hub application.

ListAppAssessments.name: ListAppAssessments
ListAppAssessments.documentation: Lists the assessments for an AWS Resilience Hub application. You can use request parameters to refine the results for the response object.

ListAppComponentCompliances.name: ListAppComponentCompliances
ListAppComponentCompliances.documentation: Lists the compliances for an AWS Resilience Hub component.

ListAppComponentRecommendations.name: ListAppComponentRecommendations
ListAppComponentRecommendations.documentation: Lists the recommendations for an AWS Resilience Hub component.

ListAppVersionResourceMappings.name: ListAppVersionResourceMappings
ListAppVersionResourceMappings.documentation: Lists how the resources in an application version are mapped/sourced from. Mappings can be physical resource identifiers, CloudFormation stacks, resource-groups, or an application registry app.

ListAppVersionResources.name: ListAppVersionResources
ListAppVersionResources.documentation: Lists all the resources in an application version.

ListAppVersions.name: ListAppVersions
ListAppVersions.documentation: Lists the different versions for the Resilience Hub applications.

ListRecommendationTemplates.name: ListRecommendationTemplates
ListRecommendationTemplates.documentation: Lists the recommendation templates for the Resilience Hub applications.

ListResiliencyPolicies.name: ListResiliencyPolicies
ListResiliencyPolicies.documentation: Lists the resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.

ListSopRecommendations.name: ListSopRecommendations
ListSopRecommendations.documentation: Lists the standard operating procedure (SOP) recommendations for the Resilience Hub applications.

ListSuggestedResiliencyPolicies.name: ListSuggestedResiliencyPolicies
ListSuggestedResiliencyPolicies.documentation: Lists the suggested resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags for your resources in your Resilience Hub applications.

ListTestRecommendations.name: ListTestRecommendations
ListTestRecommendations.documentation: Lists the test recommendations for the Resilience Hub application.

ListUnsupportedAppVersionResources.name: ListUnsupportedAppVersionResources
ListUnsupportedAppVersionResources.documentation: Lists the resources that are not currently supported in AWS Resilience Hub. An unsupported resource is a resource that exists in the object that was used to create an app, but is not supported by Resilience Hub.

PublishAppVersion.name: PublishAppVersion
PublishAppVersion.documentation: Publishes a new version of a specific Resilience Hub application.

PutDraftAppVersionTemplate.name: PutDraftAppVersionTemplate
PutDraftAppVersionTemplate.documentation: Adds or updates the app template for a draft version of a Resilience Hub app.

RemoveDraftAppVersionResourceMappings.name: RemoveDraftAppVersionResourceMappings
RemoveDraftAppVersionResourceMappings.documentation: Removes resource mappings from a draft application version.

ResolveAppVersionResources.name: ResolveAppVersionResources
ResolveAppVersionResources.documentation: Resolves the resources for an application version.

StartAppAssessment.name: StartAppAssessment
StartAppAssessment.documentation: Creates a new application assessment for an application.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Applies one or more tags to a resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes one or more tags from a resource.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You don't have permissions to perform the requested operation. The user or role that is making the request must have at least one IAM permissions policy attached that grants the required permissions.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:app/app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

resourceMappings.documentation: Mappings used to map logical resources from the template to physical resources. You can use the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application template uses a logical stack name. Or you can map individual resources by using the mapping type RESOURCE. We recommend using the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application is backed by a CloudFormation stack.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:app/app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

ConflictException.documentation: Occurs when a conflict with a previous successful write is detected. This generally occurs when the previous write did not have time to propagate to the host serving the current request. A retry (with appropriate backoff logic) is the recommended response to this exception.

format.documentation:
The format for the recommendation template.

CfnJson

The template is CloudFormation JSON.

CfnYaml

The template is CloudFormation YAML.

recommendationIds.documentation: Identifiers for the recommendations used to create a recommendation template.

recommendationTypes.documentation:
An array of strings that specify the recommendation template type or types.

Alarm

The template is an AlarmRecommendation template.

Sop

The template is a SopRecommendation template.

Test

The template is a TestRecommendation template.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific resource in your Resilience Hub application.

tags.documentation: The tags assigned to the resource. A tag is a label that you assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key/value pair.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.

nextToken.documentation: Null, or the token from a previous call to get the next set of results.

resourceGroupName.documentation: The name of the resource group that this resource belongs to.

appComponents.documentation: The application components that belong to this resource.

PhysicalResource.documentation: Defines a physical resource. A physical resource is a resource that exists in your account. It can be identified using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a Resilience Hub-native identifier.

awsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the physical resource.

awsRegion.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region that the physical resource is located in.

type.documentation:
Specifies the type of physical resource identifier.

Arn

The resource identifier is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) .

Native

The resource identifier is a Resilience Hub-native identifier.

expectedComplianceStatus.documentation: The expected compliance status after applying the recommended configuration change.

expectedRpoDescription.documentation: The expected Recovery Point Objective (RPO) description after applying the recommended configuration change.

expectedRpoInSecs.documentation: The expected RPO after applying the recommended configuration change.

format.documentation:
The format of the recommendation template.

CfnJson

The template is CloudFormation JSON.

CfnYaml

The template is CloudFormation YAML.

recommendationIds.documentation: Identifiers for the recommendations used in the recommendation template.

recommendationTemplateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the recommendation template.

recommendationTypes.documentation:
An array of strings that specify the recommendation template type or types.

Alarm

The template is an AlarmRecommendation template.

Sop

The template is a SopRecommendation template.

Test

The template is a TestRecommendation template.

logicalStackNames.documentation: The names of the CloudFormation stacks to remove from the resource mappings.

resourceNames.documentation: The names of the resources to remove from the resource mappings.

dataLocationConstraint.documentation: Specifies a high-level geographical location constraint for where your resilience policy data can be stored.

estimatedCostTier.documentation: Specifies the estimated cost tier of the resiliency policy.

tags.documentation: The tags assigned to the resource. A tag is a label that you assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key/value pair.

tier.documentation: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity (MissionCritical) to lowest (NonCritical).

disruptionScore.documentation: The disruption score for a valid key.

score.documentation: The outage score for a valid key.

ResiliencyScore.documentation: The overall resiliency score, returned as an object that includes the disruption score and outage score.

logicalResourceId.documentation: This is the identifier of the resource.

physicalResourceId.documentation: This is the identifier of the physical resource.

hasMoreErrors.documentation: This indicates if there are more errors not listed in the resourceErrors list.

resourceErrors.documentation: A list of errors retrieving an application's resources.

ResourceErrorsDetails.documentation: A list of errors retrieving an application's resources.

appRegistryAppName.documentation: The name of the application this resource is mapped to.

logicalStackName.documentation: The name of the CloudFormation stack this resource is mapped to.

mappingType.documentation:
Specifies the type of resource mapping.

AppRegistryApp

The resource is mapped to another application. The name of the application is contained in the appRegistryAppName property.

CfnStack

The resource is mapped to a CloudFormation stack. The name of the CloudFormation stack is contained in the logicalStackName property.

Resource

The resource is mapped to another resource. The name of the resource is contained in the resourceName property.

ResourceGroup

The resource is mapped to a resource group. The name of the resource group is contained in the resourceGroupName property.

resourceGroupName.documentation: The name of the resource group this resource is mapped to.

resourceName.documentation: The name of the resource this resource is mapped to.

terraformSourceName.documentation: The short name of the Terraform source.

resourceId.documentation: The identifier of the resource that the exception applies to.

resourceType.documentation: The type of the resource that the exception applies to.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource could not be found.

bucket.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

prefix.documentation: The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket.

S3Location.documentation: The location of the Amazon S3 bucket.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded your service quota. To perform the requested action, remove some of the relevant resources, or use Service Quotas to request a service quota increase.

referenceId.documentation: The reference identifier for the SOP recommendation.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:app/app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

clientToken.documentation: Used for an idempotency token. A client token is a unique, case-sensitive string of up to 64 ASCII characters. You should not reuse the same client token for other API requests.

tags.documentation: The tags assigned to the resource. A tag is a label that you assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key/value pair.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

tags.documentation: The tags to assign to the resource. Each tag consists of a key/value pair.

s3StateFileUrl.documentation: The Terraform s3 state file you need to import.

TerraformSource.documentation: The Terraform s3 state file you need to import.

dependsOnAlarms.documentation: A list of recommended alarms that are used in the test and must be exported before or with the test.

referenceId.documentation: The reference identifier for the test recommendation.

risk.documentation: The level of risk for this test recommendation.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the operation.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The limit on the number of requests per second was exceeded.

logicalResourceId.documentation: The logical resource identifier for the unsupported resource.

physicalResourceId.documentation: The physical resource identifier for the unsupported resource.

UnsupportedResource.documentation: Defines a resource that is not supported by Resilience Hub.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

tagKeys.documentation: The keys of the tags to remove.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:app/app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

assessmentSchedule.documentation: Assessment execution schedule with 'Daily' or 'Disabled' values.

clearResiliencyPolicyArn.documentation: Specifies if the resiliency policy ARN should be cleared.

policyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resiliency policy. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:resiliency-policy/policy-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

app.documentation: The specified application, returned as an object with details including compliance status, creation time, description, resiliency score, and more.

dataLocationConstraint.documentation: Specifies a high-level geographical location constraint for where your resilience policy data can be stored.

policy.documentation:
The type of resiliency policy to be created, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds.

If you do not want to specify regional targets for a regional policy, you must set the values of rpoInSecs and rtoInSecs to -1.

policyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resiliency policy. The format for this ARN is: arn:partition:resiliencehub:region:account:resiliency-policy/policy-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

tier.documentation: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity (MissionCritical) to lowest (NonCritical).

policy.documentation: The type of resiliency policy that was updated, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds.

ValidationException.documentation: Indicates that a request was not valid.

documentation: AWS Resilience Hub helps you proactively prepare and protect your Amazon Web Services applications from disruptions. Resilience Hub offers continuous resiliency assessment and validation that integrates into your software development lifecycle. This enables you to uncover resiliency weaknesses, ensure recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) targets for your applications are met, and resolve issues before they are released into production.
